content: In which Shakespeare play does the phrase "To be or not to be" appear?

The phrase "To be or not to be" appears in William Shakespeare's play "Hamlet." It is part of one of the most famous soliloquies in literature, spoken by the character Prince Hamlet in Act 3, Scene 1. This soliloquy delves into themes of existence, mortality, and the human condition, reflecting Hamlet's contemplation of life and death.
